empty_challenge: go back to fill this in

define.alert: Fill in the above to continue!
define.inspired: inspired by TED talk of Tim Ferris

fear.title: Name the worst things you can image happening if you took this step
fear.subtitle: It's good to put these thoughts into words because fear of the unkown is usually worse than something specific.
fear.alert: Please fill in at least 1 item to continue

prevent.title: What can I do to prevent or decrease the likelihood of these happening
prevent.subtitle: This will help you see if there is anything actionable to decrease your fear.
prevent.alert: Please fill in at least 1 item to continue, this doesn't have to be big, it is just part of the exercise to see if there is anything in your control.

fix.title: If this happens, what can I do to fix this? Who could I ask for help?
fix.subtitle: Ask yourself has anyone with your capabilities ever got them selves out of this situation? Probably yes, how would they have done it?
fix.alert: Please fill in at least 1 item to continue, this doesn't have to be big, it is just part of the exercise to see if there is anything in your control.

benefit.title: What are the benefits of an attempt or even a (partial) success?
benefit.alert: Surely there has to be a benefit to it?

inaction.title: What is the cost of inaction?
inaction.subtitle: We often worry about the consequences of doing something but less often think about the consequences of inaction.
inaction.alert: All fields are required. This can be anything, even "I will have forgotten all about it"

overview.benefits: Benefits of a attempt or (partial) success

example.define: Example: Try to make a web app that helps make big decisions
example.fear_1: Example: It will take forever to complete it
example.fear_2: Example: I won't be able to complete it because of a technical hurdle
example.fear_3: Example: No one will use it
example.prevent_1: Example: focus on only core functionality
example.prevent_2: Example: give development of this project high priority until I complete the core functionality
example.prevent_3: Example: Outsource parts if possible to be able to focus on the product
example.fix_1: Example: Ask my friend who is a freelance web developer for paid help.
example.fix_2: Example: Put the project aside for a while, focus on more pressing things in my life
example.benefit_1: Example: I will have made a useful tool for myself and others
example.benefit_2: Example: I will have a working product to show for in my next job interview
example.benefit_3: Example: I could expand it to have a paid feature so that I can continue making apps that I think are useful.
example.incation_1: Example: I still won't have much to show for in job interviews.
example.incation_2: Example: Working for a employer I will probably wonder how it would have been if I tried to start a own project while I had the time
example.incation_3: Example: I will probably have forgotten all about it.

quote.quote_1: Named must your fear be before banish it you can.
quote.quote_2: Do something that scares you everyday, you have nothing to lose but fear itself
